text: so Nora is an AI platform that
transforms customer engagement what that
means is we allow brands with mobile
apps to really understand their users
and deliver personalized contextualized
experiences that result in much higher
engagement retention and conversion
the interesting thing about deira was
that we got a lot of attention from day
one but to figure out how to become an
essential ingredient in our customers
journey was a challenge for us and to do
that with a very small team when we
started that the most of the team had to
deal with developing the technology and
with scaling it up was definitely a
challenge we've been
if you look from a customer
what is an app that does transportation
or ride-sharing trying to find they're
trying to find a user who needs a ride
who needs a ride to work let's say in
the morning so when Nora is able to do
is provide them with the ability to
react to that need in real time and
reach each user that needs a ride to
work so if we look at morning commuters
in Manhattan they're all morning
commuters they all need a ride to work
but they don't all leave home at the
same time and they have many options on
how to get to work so with Nora they can
find morning commuters by understanding
these users in the real world and they
can reach them when they're about to
leave home but that sort of example
works across many industries so
insurance companies and health companies
need to reach their users when their
users are in need of a specific service
a medication adherence service the
diabetes management service it's really
about context and about understanding
who the user is in the real world and
what they're doing right now
so when we started as a small startup
with just one monolithic server and a
manual deployment then we used AWS
services to move to a global and
virtually unlimited deployment using AWS
abilities to scale we've used for that
ec2 and AWS SG abilities other than this
we use we use Genesis with DynamoDB we
use s3 and cleaner to help us scale
we really understand the users in the
real world and we do that by
transforming physical sensory data into
real-world insights and so brands with
mobile apps are able to deliver
experiences that are much more relevant
to users because right now what they're
doing is they're understanding their
users based on web behavior data and
in-app data but they really don't
deliver relevant experiences and they
cause notification fatigue and turn and
even like if you look at the number of
notifications that are opened in the
industry it's less than 8% so there's a
really big gap between what brands with
apps know about their customers and what
the customers really need and prefer and
so Nura is able to bridge that gap
